intro: Odontites tenuifolius var. australis, commonly known as the slender-leaved toothwort, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky stream banks. The plant features small, heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of delicate, white or pale pink flowers. Its scientific name reflects its slender foliage and its classification within the Ranunculaceae family. Odontites tenuifolius var. australis is characterized by its unique morphology and ecological adaptations to its native habitat.
